Class Account

java.lang.Object
Account
public abstract class Account extends Object
The Account class is an abstract representation of a bank account. It provides the basic structure for accounts with account numbers and balances, and it requires subclasses to implement specific behaviors such as depositing, withdrawing, displaying balances, logging transactions, and getting credit limits. This class cannot be instantiated directly; it must be subclassed to provide concrete implementations for its abstract methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account()
      Default constructor for Account class. Initializes a default account with no parameters.

    • Account

      public Account(int accountNumber, double accountBalance)
      Constructs an Account object with the specified account number and initial balance.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - The unique number identifying the account.
      accountBalance - The initial balance of the account.

  • Method Details

    • getBalance

      public double getBalance()
      Gets the current balance of the account.
      Returns:
      The current balance of the account.

    • getAccountNumber

      public int getAccountNumber()
      Gets the account number of the account.
      Returns:
      The account number.

    • setAccountNumber

      public void setAccountNumber(int accountNumber)
      Sets the account number of the account.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - The new account number.

    • setBalance

      public void setBalance(double balance)
      Sets the balance of the account.
      Parameters:
      balance - The new balance of the account.

    • deposit

      public abstract void deposit(double amount)
      Abstract method for depositing an amount into the account.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to be deposited.

    • withdraw

      public abstract boolean withdraw(double amount)
      Abstract method for withdrawing an amount from the account. This method returns a boolean value indicating whether the withdrawal was successful.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to be withdrawn.
      Returns:
      true if the withdrawal is successful, false otherwise.

    • displayBalance

      public abstract void displayBalance()
      Abstract method for displaying the current balance of the account.

    • toLogtxt

      public abstract void toLogtxt(Person customer)
      Abstract method for logging the account details to a text file.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer associated with this account.

    • getLimit

      public abstract double getLimit()
      Abstract method to get the credit limit of the account. This will be relevant for credit accounts.
      Returns:
      The credit limit of the account.
